title: Drawing, "Bishop saint adoring Christ Child", ca. 1725–50
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash, graphite on cream laid paper
markings: Verso, collector's stamp in blue ink: MB (no Lugt)
signed: Signed in graphite, lower left: Giaquinto 2
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Kneeling saint is looking up at a vision of the Christ Child holding a cross in one hand and an orb in another. In the lower right, an undressed older woman is crying out in despair and tearing at her hair.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Bishop saint adoring Christ Child", ca. 1725–50.
ca. 1725–50. Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash, graphite on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-8114.
